newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli planes, helicopters raid south of Beirut.
newsitem.headline: Israeli planes, helicopters raid south of Beirut.

text.p: Israeli aircraft raided Palestinian guerrilla targets on hilltops south of Beirut on Saturday, security sources said.

Two helicopters fired two rockets at the Na'ameh hills 15 km (nine miles) south of Beirut, where the radical Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine General Command (PFLP-GC) has bases, they said.
PFLP-GC sources and residents said Israeli fighter planes also took part in the raid.
The security sources and the PFLP-GC said there were no immediate reports of casualties in the raid.
The operation raised to 50 the number of Israeli air raids on Lebanon this year.
Lebanese army units fired anti-aircraft guns at the Israeli helicopters but they were not hit, the security sources said.
